content: Parable of the Good Shepherd
[on the stone wall],   [the protector and provider].  [the gate]  [knowing that they listen]  [to pasture].
Jesus used this figure of speech with them, but they did not understand what He was talking about.

So Jesus said again,  [leading to life].  [as false messiahs and self-appointed leaders]  [true]   [and will live forever],  [freely],   [to the full, till it overflows]. [own]   [who merely serves for wages],   [who serves only for wages]  [safety of the]   [without any doubt those who are]  [and have a deep, personal relationship with Me]—  [very own]  [sacrificing it]   [beside these]   [own]
A division [of opinion] occurred again among the Jews because of these words [of His].
Many of them said, “He has a demon and He is mad [insane—He raves and rambles]. Why listen to Him?”
Others were saying, “These are not the words  thoughts of one possessed by a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
Jesus Asserts His Deity
At that time the Feast of Dedication took place at Jerusalem.
It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple [area] in Solomon’s portico.
So the Jews surrounded Him and began saying to Him, “How long are You going to keep us in suspense? If You are [really] the Christ (the Messiah, the Anointed), tell us so plainly  openly.”
Jesus answered them,  [they are My credentials and the evidence declaring who I am].  [so you do not trust and follow Me]    [by any means]    [in essence and nature].”
Again the Jews picked up stones to stone Him.
Jesus answered them,  [and many acts of mercy]
The Jews answered Him, “We are not going to stone You for a good work, but for blasphemy, because You, a  man, make Yourself out to be God.”
Jesus answered them,  [human judges representing God, not divine beings]’?
[if that is true]   [that is, the miracles that only God could perform],   [at least]  [that I do—admit that they are the works of God],  [clearly—without any doubt]  [that is, I am One with Him].”
So they tried again to seize Him, but He eluded their grasp.
He went back again across the Jordan to the place where John was first baptizing, and He was staying there.
Many came to Him, and they were saying, “John did not perform a single sign (attesting miracle), but everything John said about this Man was true  accurate.”
And many there believed  confidently trusted in Him [accepting Him as Savior, and following His teaching].
